correctResponse.text: That's right! You selected the correct response.

question.text: It is your responsibility to decide your status within the taxicab company
It is ________responsibility to decide your status within the taxicab company.

response.text: Your boss's
The government's
None of the above

question.text: It is the government's responsibility to decide your status within the taxicab company.

correctResponse.text: That's right! You selected the correct response.

question.text: Why does your employment status matter?

response.text: Legal liability
Social status
U.S. citizenship
All of the above

question.text: Your employment status within the company is not important, as long as you are making money.
Your legal liabilities depend on your ________.

response.text: Employment status
Work shift
Attitude towards passengers
None of the above

correctResponse.text: That's right! You selected the correct response.

question.text: If you own your own vehicle or lease it from an independent party, you're probably an ________.

response.text: Independent contractor

question.text: Which of the following statements is usually true regarding independent contractor status?

response.text: You own or lease your vehicle for a fee
You report earnings to the company
You are required to accept dispatch calls
You are required to work particular shifts or locations

question.text: As an independent contractor, you may own or lease your vehicle for a fee.

correctResponse.text: That's right! You selected the correct response.

response.text: Responsible for reporting his/her taxes to the cab company
Responsible for all tax reporting
Not responsible for state income tax reporting
None of the above

question.text: Which of the following statements usually applies to independent contractor status?

response.text: You are covered by minimum wage or overtime regulations
You are entitled to unemployment
You are provided with health insurance
Taxes are not taken out of your paycheck

question.text: An independent contractor is responsible for all tax reporting.

correctResponse.text: That's right! You selected the correct response.

question.text: As an employee, the taxicab company is required to withhold federal and state income tax, and FICA and Medicare taxes, from your compensation.
Which of the following statements apply to employee status?

response.text: Your taxes are withheld from your paycheck
You are not required to accept dispatch calls
You are not required to work particular shifts or locations
All of the above

question.text: Which of the following statements are true of an employee?

response.text: The company withholds payroll taxes and reports your earnings to the IRS on From W-2
You are required by the taxicab company to accept dispatch calls
You are entitled to unemployment and worker's compensation
All of the above

correctResponse.text: That's right! You selected the correct response.

question.text: If you are an employee, you are entitled to unemployment and worker's compensation.

response.text: You are entitled to minimum wage
You are entitled to unemployment and worker's compensation
Both of these

question.text: Which of the following statements is NOT usually true of an employee?

response.text: You are entitled to keep all fares and tips you receive from passengers
You are entitled to minimum wage
You are entitled to unemployment and worker's compensation
None of the above
